name: Heimlich for Others (Adult)
description: Perform Heimlich maneuver on a choking adult
warning: Only use if person cannot cough, speak, or breathe. For adults only.
emergency_notes: If person becomes unconscious, start CPR immediately

steps.title: Assess if They Can Cough
steps.description: If the person could cough, ask the person to cough if it can solve the choking.
steps.voice_prompt: Ask the person to cough if they are able to.
steps.critical_warning: If person can cough or speak, encourage coughing - do not perform Heimlich yet

steps.title: Stand Behind the Person
steps.description: If the person can't cough, stand behind the person and put your arms around their belly.
steps.voice_prompt: Stand behind the person and wrap your arms around their waist.

steps.title: Make a Fist
steps.description: Make a fist with one hand and clasp your other hand tightly around it.
steps.voice_prompt: Make a fist with one hand and clasp your other hand around it.

steps.title: Position Your Fist
steps.description: Place the thumb side of your fist just below their ribcage and about two inches above their belly button.
steps.voice_prompt: Place your fist just below the ribcage, two inches above the belly button.
steps.critical_warning: Correct positioning is crucial for effectiveness and safety

steps.title: Perform 5 Thrusts
steps.description: Sharply and quickly thrust your hands inward and upward five times.
steps.voice_prompt: Perform five quick, forceful inward and upward thrusts.
steps.critical_warning: Use significant force - you need to expel the object

steps.title: Repeat or Start CPR
steps.description: Repeat this process until you free the object stuck in their windpipe or person becomes unconscious. If the person becomes unconscious, start CPR.
steps.voice_prompt: Continue thrusts until object is expelled. If person becomes unconscious, immediately start CPR.
steps.critical_warning: If person becomes unconscious, lay them down and begin CPR immediately
